links.title: 4 Monster Stock Predictions For Earnings During The Week of April 30
links.description: The week of April 30 will be the last big week for earnings, and the headliner will be Apple on Tuesday and Tesla on Wednesday. There are plenty of other companies, due up with MasterCard and Square. But let's face it, Apple has a whole supply chain that is likely to move with it.

links.title: The Mott Capital First-Quarter Investor Letter - Volatility Rising
links.description: The first quarter was full of stock market volality, and it is likely to last for some time longer. But nontheless the stocks should be boosted by strong earnings growth. The Mott Capital investor letter discusses the outlook.

messages.body: $TSLA Don't believe the short FUD https://cleantechnica.com/2018/04/29/much-of-teslas-stock-is-held-by-institutional-investors-why-do-short-sellers-claim-otherwise/

links.title: Much Of Tesla's Stock Is Held By Institutional Investors. Why Do Short Sellers Claim Otherwise?
links.description: Many of the talking points used by those short selling Tesla's stock revolve around the idea that the company's stock is largely held by individual investors who don't understand that the company: is (permanently apparently) on the verge of collapse; is actually in need of funding that it says it doesn't need; and/or doesn't make the margins on the cars it sells that it reports it does.
